# Datelife examples


The goal of this repo is to show the possibilities of usage of the **`datelife`** package, by producing pdf reports of the information status of organisms of interest. 

Following is a list with links to the `datelife` reports currently available:

<!-- ``` {r echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE, message = FALSE, results = 'asis'}
# emo::ji("speak_no_evil")
# emo::ji("lizard")
# emo::ji("whale")
# emo::ji("bird")
# emo::ji("bat")
# emo::ji("penguin")
``` -->

- `r emo::ji("lizard")` [Anolis](https://github.com/LunaSare/datelife_examples/blob/master/docs/Anolis_report.pdf)
- `r emo::ji("whale")` [Cetaceae](https://github.com/LunaSare/datelife_examples/blob/master/docs/Cetacea_report.pdf)
- `r emo::ji("bird")` [Fringillidae](https://github.com/LunaSare/datelife_examples/blob/master/docs/Fringillidae_report.pdf)
- `r emo::ji("bat")` [Phyllostomidae](https://github.com/LunaSare/datelife_examples/blob/master/docs/Phyllostomidae_report.pdf)
- `r emo::ji("speak_no_evil")` [Primates](https://github.com/LunaSare/datelife_examples/blob/master/docs/Primates_report.pdf)
- `r emo::ji("penguin")` [Spheniscidae](https://github.com/LunaSare/datelife_examples/blob/master/docs/Spheniscidae_report.pdf)
